metadata.dc:author: Colombo, M
Reyes, J
Holmgren, J
metadata.dc:description: Duchenne muscular dystrophy is a well defined form of sex linked inherited muscular disease. Approximately 1/3 of cases are the product of a new mutation. We studied 20 patients with this disease and 19 heterozygous females. Ceruloplasmin levels were significantly higher in patients compared to controls. A possible protective role of this enzyme against oxydating agents may help prevent peroxydation of lipids from the smooth muscle cell membrane.
metadata.dc:title: Ceruloplasmina en pacientes y portadores de distrofia muscular de Duchenne.
[Ceruloplasmin in patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy].
